events.name: Introduction to Serverless on GCP
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Looking to get this meetup rolling again, and I think the best way to do this is to just set a date and place to meet! My employer, Neudesic, has agreed to allow me to host the meeting at our HQ at Suite 2000, 200 Spectrum Center Drive. I look forward to meeting you there.

Parking

Parking at the Spectrum can be an issue. I suggest that guests park in the 100 Spectrum Center Drive parking lot and walk to 200. Parking is free after 5 or 6pm, so even if you have to take a ticket to enter you can leave the structure for free.
events.how_to_find_us: Neudesic, 200 Spectrum Center Drive, Suite 2000, Irvine CA 92618

events.name: Containers on GCP
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

The votes are in and the clear winner is "Containers on GCP"! Please join us on Tuesday September 26th for a demo of different ways to use containers on Google Cloud Platform. If you have specific questions let me know and we'll try to address in the demonstration.

Parking

Parking at the Spectrum can be an issue. I suggest that guests park in the 100 Spectrum Center Drive parking lot and walk to 200. Parking is free after 5pm, so even if you have to take a ticket to enter you can leave the structure for free.
events.how_to_find_us: Neudesic, 200 Spectrum Center Drive, Suite 2000, Irvine CA 92618

events.name: Cloud IoT Core by example
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Lately I've been working on an IoT project for a client, and I'd like to share some of our discoveries encountered in our short time working with Google IoT Core.

Parking

Parking at the Spectrum can be an issue. I suggest that guests park in the 100 Spectrum Center Drive parking lot and walk to 200. Parking is free after 5pm, so even if you have to take a ticket to enter you can leave the structure for free.
events.how_to_find_us: Neudesic, 200 Spectrum Center Drive, Suite 2000, Irvine CA 92618

events.name: Sentiment Analysis using Tensorflow
events.description:
Come join us as Jarid and Jason discuss using TensorFlow for sentiment analysis.

Parking

Parking at the Spectrum can be an issue. I suggest that guests park in the 100 Spectrum Center Drive parking lot and walk to 200. Parking is free after 5 or 6pm, so even if you have to take a ticket to enter you can leave the structure for free.
events.how_to_find_us: Neudesic, 200 Spectrum Center Drive, Suite 2000, Irvine CA 92618

events.name: Continuous deployment of microservices on GKE
events.description:
Join us on Tuesday February 27th as we talk about, and demonstrate techniques to deploy microservices to Google Kubernetes Engine. You'll be dreaming of blue & green canaries for days.

Focus will be on Google Cloud native tools (Container Registry, Container Builder) and open-source solutions like Spinnaker and Jenkins. Come prepared to ask questions and share your CI/CD stories.

Parking at the Spectrum can be an issue. I suggest that guests park in the 100 Spectrum Center Drive parking lot and walk to our building; parking at 100 Spectrum Center is free after 5pm. Even if you have to take a ticket to enter you will be able to leave the structure for free.
events.how_to_find_us: We're on the 20th floor, and signs will be posted to direct you to the meeting. Send an IM through Meetup app if you arrive after the elevators stop!

events.name: Streaming data analysis with GCP tools
events.description:
Join the Ananth and the Neudesic team as we discuss and demonstrate streaming data analysis with Pub/Sub, Dataflow and Data Studio.

Parking at the Spectrum can be an issue. I suggest that guests park in the 100 Spectrum Center Drive parking lot and walk to our office. Parking is free after 5pm, so even if you have to take a ticket to enter you can leave the structure for free.
events.how_to_find_us: We're on the 20th floor, and signs will be posted to direct you to the meeting. Send an IM through Meetup app if you arrive after 6pm.

events.name: Toxic comment classification using Cloud ML and TensorFlow
events.description: Jigsaw sponsored a recent Kaggle competition with the goal of identifying toxic comments in social media. Toxic comments are the comments that cause other people to leave a social conversation. The threat of abuse and harassment online means that many people stop expressing themselves and give up on seeking different opinions. In this talk, we will explore one possible solution using TensorFlow with embedding vectors to learn word meaning. We will also discuss the problem of bias in machine learning solutions.
events.how_to_find_us: We're on the 20th floor, and signs will be posted to direct you to the meeting. Send an IM through Meetup app if you arrive after 6pm. Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive and it’s a quick walk to us at 200.

events.name: Google IO Extended OC, day 1
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Can't attend the Google IO event in person? Join us as the OC GCP meetup group reviews the best of the keynotes and presentations from IO 2018!

This is day 1 - don't forget to sign-up for days 2 and 3.
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive for free and walk to 200. We're on the 20th floor, and signs will be posted to direct you to the meeting. Send an IM through Meetup app if you arrive after 6pm.

events.name: Google IO Extended OC, day 2 + Flutter Workshop
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Can't attend the Google IO event in person? Join us as the OC GCP meetup group reviews the best of the keynotes and presentations from IO 2018!

This meetup will also feature a workshop where you can build a flutter app and run it on your phone! With a few pre-reqs.

If you would like to participate please perform the following before coming:
-Install flutter as detailed here: https://flutter.io/get-started/install/
Ideally you would have be able to run "flutter doctor" from terminal/command prompt and have no errors. If there is any issues setting this up please come half an hour early and we will do our best to help get you set up!
-Familiarize yourself with dart, a quick high level guide should be more than enough.

A few notes on the Flutter workshop:
-A mac will be required to install onto an iOS device. This is an Apple requirement and neither we nor Google have any control over it.
-The code will be a simple app, with limited in-workshop customizations.

This is day 2 - don't forget to sign-up for days 1 and 3.
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive for free and walk to 200. We're on the 20th floor, and signs will be posted to direct you to the meeting. Send an IM through Meetup app if you arrive after 6pm.

events.name: Google IO Extended OC, day 3
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Can't attend the Google IO event in person? Join us as the OC GCP meetup group reviews the best of the keynotes and presentations from IO 2018!

This is day 3 - don't forget to sign-up for days 1 and 2.
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive for free and walk to 200. We're on the 20th floor, and signs will be posted to direct you to the meeting. Send an IM through Meetup app if you arrive after 6pm.

events.name: Cross-platform mobile applications with Flutter and Firebase
events.description:
Jarid and Jake will demonstrate how to create a slick mobile application for Android and iOS with Flutter and Firebase.

Stick around after the talk as we'll walk through creating a simple Flutter application from scratch!
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive and walk over to our building. We're on the 20th floor, and signs will be posted to direct you to the meeting. Send an IM through Meetup app if you arrive after 6pm.

events.name: Google Assistant: Build Actions for Your Community
events.description:
We are to be joined by a guest speaker!

Jessica Dene Earley-Cha is a Developer Advocate for Google Assistant. She loves to connect with developers and explore VUI (voice user interface) to add another dimension to how user interact with technology. Jessica is a full stack developer who enjoys sharing knowledge and support others. Jessica is the co-organizer for Google Developers Group San Francisco, is a Women Techmakers lead and a teacher for Girl Develop It. You’ll find her either spending time with her dog, collecting strawberry knick knack or coding one of her many personal projects.

On Wednesday July 11th, there will be a follow-on meeting at Neudesic offices to host a workshop where we will breakout into smaller groups to see what we can build in just a few hours!

RSVP for the workshop at https://www.meetup.com/gdgcloudoc/events/250845000/

events.name: Workshop: Build Actions for Your Community
events.description:
Now to put your understanding into action - see what I did there! This is a working session where we will break into smaller groups and see who can build the most interesting Google Assistant action in the time alloted.

I'll add more details, pre-requisites, etc. to this meeting in the days to come.

NOTE: This is a hands-on session following our regular meetup "Google Assistant: Build Actions for Your Community" - RSVP for that event at https://www.meetup.com/gdgcloudoc/events/lslthpyxjbjc/
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive for free, and walk to our building. We're on the 20th floor, and signs will be posted to direct you to the meeting. Send an IM through Meetup app if you arrive after 6pm.

events.name: Immutable architecture and infrastructure as code
events.description: Learn about infrastructure as code and terraform best practices at August's meetup. See you at Neudesic HQ 8/28.
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive because it is free after 5pm, and walk to 200. We're on the 20th floor, and signs will be posted to direct you to the meeting. Send an IM through Meetup app if you arrive after 6pm.

events.name: What's new in ML on GCP - BQML and ML APIs
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Join us at Google Irvine to learn more about recent announcements for machine learning on Google Cloud Platform. Google Customer Engineers Andre Walker-Upshur (@aupshur88 on Twitter), Ryan Zapanta, and Vijay Pawar will dive into BQML and the updated ML APIs, and demonstrate how to use them to solve real-world scenarios.

Please remember that an RSVP is required and that there is a hard cut-off at 11:59pm on Sunday September 23!
events.how_to_find_us: The Google building is off Jamboree, close to MacArthur. Attendance is strictly by RSVP as a security badge will be required. You may park in the Google parking structure for a fee.

events.name: Building solutions with Istio and Knative on GKE and Kubernetes
events.description:
Join Google and Neudesic for an evening of Kubernetes at Google's Irvine campus. Kent will lead the group in an overview of Kubernetes and GKE, before diving into Istio. Matthew will talk about Knative and options for deploying serverless applications on Kubernetes and the upcoming Serverless add-on for GKE.

Please take the pre-event survey on development languages at https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/5Q8GGV5

Note: Google security requires that all attendees RSVP by Sunday December 2nd so that visitor badges can be prepared for each attendee. As such, RSVP option will be closed at 11:59pm PST Sunday 12/2 to make sure we have a final list.

Speakers:

Kent Hua is a Google Cloud Customer Engineer Specialist for AppDev focused on components such as Google Kubernetes Engine, CI/CD and Serverless. He has years of experience working with customers on both their business and technical challenges.

Matthew Emes is Director, Google Cloud at Neudesic, and helps clients deliver solutions using native Google Cloud products. Matthew can be reached @matthewemes on Twitter, or through GDG Cloud OC slack at https://goo.gl/bZ76kn
events.how_to_find_us: Park in the Google parking structure next to building. Check-in with Google security and let them know you'll be attending the user group meeting in "The Wedge".

events.name: Securing GCP
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Join us at Neudesic HQ to learn about options and techniques for securing your Google Cloud Platform projects. Our guest speaker is Alex Butnareanu, a Google Customer Engineer specialising in Security on GCP.

Looking forward to seeing you at Neudesic Irvine!
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive because it is free after 5pm, and walk to 200. We're on the 20th floor, and signs will be posted to direct you to the meeting.

events.name: Serverless GCP in 2019
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Join Google and Neudesic for a session on Serverless options on GCP. Neudesic’s GCP Practice Director Matthew Emes will lead a discussion on what is serverless, how to implement a source-to-deployment pipeline, and how to choose a serverless platform on GCP.

Cloud Run, Cloud Functions, App Engine, and more!

We need to know who is planning to attend in advance; please RSVP by Sunday April 21st.

NOTE: location has changed to Neudesic office!
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive - it’s free after 5pm and just a few minutes walk to Neudesic.

events.name: Full-scale App Deployment on GCP
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Join Google and Neudesic for a talk lead by Noumaan Shah, on his experiences deploying applications to GCP.

We need to know who is planning to attend in advance; please RSVP by Sunday before the meeting.

NOTE: location has changed to Neudesic office until further notice!
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive - it’s free after 5pm and just a few minutes walk to Neudesic.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - ML APIs on Google
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Join us at Neudesic Irvine for an extended session to learn how to use Google Cloud's machine learning APIs in your own projects. Bring a laptop, as we'll be completing on-line quests to use Google's APIs to extract, analyze and translate text from images, implement a cluster to classify images posted to r/aww subreddit, and deploy Tensorflow models to Cloud ML Engine.

After our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

Credits are limited, so please RSVP to attend. See you there!
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive - it’s free to park after 5pm and just a few minutes walk to Neudesic.

events.name: Firebase 101
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Join us at Neudesic to get an introduction to Firebase and learn how you can use it to kick-start mobile and web applications. Looking forward to seeing you all there!

NOTE: location has changed to Neudesic office until further notice!
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive - it’s free after 5pm and just a few minutes walk to Neudesic.

events.name: React Native and Firebase
events.description:
Hello GCPers!

Join Google and Neudesic for a session on the latest in GCP. Topic will be announced soon!

We need to know who is planning to attend in advance; please RSVP by Sunday before the meeting.

NOTE: location has changed to Neudesic office until further notice!
events.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive - it’s free after 5pm and just a few minutes walk to Neudesic.

upcoming.name: Cloud Study Jam - TensorFlow on GCP
upcoming.description:
Hello GCPers!

Join us at Neudesic Irvine for an extended session to learn how to use Tensorflow and Google Cloud's services in your own projects. Bring a laptop, as we'll be completing on-line quests to setup and classify images, and to predict house prices from historical data.

After our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

Credits are limited, so please RSVP to attend. See you there!

NOTE: location has changed to Neudesic office until further notice!
upcoming.how_to_find_us: Park at 100 Spectrum Center Drive - it’s free after 5pm and just a few minutes walk to Neudesic.

answers.question: How long have you been using Google Cloud Platform professionally?
What are you looking to get out of this group? Any particular topics that are of interest to you?
Are you willing to present on a topic that may be interesting to the group?

group_profile.intro: Hello, my name is Jarid and I am a Senior Consultant at Neudesic. I primarily work around mobility, but more recently have been playing with cloud architecture in both AWS and GCP. Note: this group is independent of Neudesic and opinions are my own.

organizers.name: Matthew E.
organizers.bio: Cloud Architect and open-source advocate. Working as a Director with clients to make best use of Google Cloud Platform.

answers.question: How long have you been using Google Cloud Platform professionally?
answers.answer: I've been using GCP since mid-2015 and am a "Google Certified Professional - Cloud Architect". Along with infrastructure, I like to build mobile applications with Firebase, and I want to gain a deeper understanding of machine learning and analytics.

answers.question: What are you looking to get out of this group? Any particular topics that are of interest to you?
answers.answer: Looking to connect and evangelise GCP products. Machine learning is something I am most interested in knowing more about.

answers.question: Are you willing to present on a topic that may be interesting to the group?
answers.answer:
Yes. I guess I really have too :-)
I can present on infrastructure and development projects.

group_profile.intro:
Hello, I am Matthew and I am Director of Google Platform for Neudesic where I am responsible for driving adoption of GCP products internally, and for clients.

Note: this group is independent of Neudesic and opinions are my own.

answers.question: How long have you been using Google Cloud Platform professionally?
What are you looking to get out of this group? Any particular topics that are of interest to you?
Are you willing to present on a topic that may be interesting to the group?
